channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech

item.title: Liverpool vs Aston Villa live stream: How to watch Premier League 2025/26, TV channels, broadcasters
item.description: All the ways to watch Liverpool vs Aston Villa live streams online and from anywhere as the Reds welcome Unai Emery's side to Anfield.
item.dc:creator: Sam May, TechRadar

item.title: Everything new on Disney+ in November 2025: The Fantastic Four: First Steps, All's Fair, and more
item.description: From The Fantastic Four's latest big-screen adventure to Kim Kardashian's new TV show, here's what's coming to Disney+ this month.
item.dc:creator: Tom Power, TechRadar

item.title: Windows 10 users face ransomware nightmare as Microsoft support ends in 2025 worldwide
item.description: Microsoft warns Windows 10 users face serious security risks as 90% of ransomware attacks target unsupported systems. Learn why upgrading to Windows 11 is crucial.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Adobe struggles to assure investors that it can thrive in AI era
item.description: Adobe Inc. brought together 10,000 marketers, filmmakers and content creators to its annual conference this week to persuade them that the company's software products are adapting to artificial intelligence and remain the best tools for their work.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg, The Mercury News

item.title: AMD has ended support for RX 6000 GPUs – here's why it's a massive blunder in the battle against Nvidia
item.description: In a baffling move, AMD ends support for relatively recent RX 6000 GPUs – and gamers are up in arms (myself included).
item.dc:creator: Darren Allan, TechRadar

item.title: Fortnite The Simpsons start time: our live coverage of today's The Simpsons update now that Fortnite is in downtime
item.description: Here's our live coverage of the Fortnite The Simpsons update, including everything you need to know now that it's in downtime.
item.dc:creator: Jake Green, TechRadar

item.title: Nvidia partners with South Korean government, companies to boost AI development
item.description: Silicon Valley chipmaker Nvidia plans to supply its graphics processing units for projects with the South Korean businesses and government to advance the country’s artificial intelligence infrastructure and technologies.
item.dc:creator: Kim Tong-Hyung, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: In the future, U.S. troops won’t just deploy drones. They’ll make them
item.description: For U.S. soldiers who find themselves at the front lines of a future conflict, it’s fast becoming gospel, due to the way warfare is rapidly evolving on the battlefields of Ukraine, that drones will be crucial to winning (or losing) the fight But the roughly 500 U.S.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Sisson, Fast Company

item.title: Rust 1.91 promotes Windows on Arm64 to Tier 1 target
item.description: The Rust Release Team has released Rust 1.91, an update of the popular memory-safe programming language that promotes Windows on Arm64 platform to a Tier 1 supported target. Rust 1.91 was announced October 30. Previous users can upgrade by running rustup update stable.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Visual Studio October update adds Claude coding models
item.description: Microsoft has released the October 2025 update for Visual Studio 2022 (v17.14). The new release makes the Claude Sonnet 4.5 and Claude Haiku 4.5 coding models available in the GitHub Copilot chat window.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: How tiny drones inspired by bats could save lives in dark and stormy conditions
item.description: WORCESTER, Mass. (AP) — Don't be fooled by the fog machine, spooky lights and fake bats: the robotics lab at Worcester Polytechnic Institute lab isn't hosting a Halloween party.
item.dc:creator: HOLLY RAMER, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Universal Music and AI song tool Udio settle lawsuit and partner on new platform, sparking backlash
item.description: LONDON (AP) — Universal Music Group and AI song generation platform Udio have settled a copyright infringement lawsuit and agreed to team up on new music creation and streaming platform, the two companies said in a joint announcement.
item.dc:creator: KELVIN CHAN, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: Nvidia valuation reaches $5 trillion
item.description:
The value of Nvidia’s stock has increased significantly in recent years, largely due to the high demand for its AI chips.
According to Reuters, another milestone was passed during Wednesday’s trading on the Nasdaq stock exchange, as Nvidia became the first company to be valued at $5 trillion.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Oracle’s cloud strategy an increasingly risky bet
item.description: The financing arrangement for Oracle’s massive data center plan aimed at feeding the AI monster could result in a $38 billion debt offering as soon as next week, and according to this week’s report from Morgan Stanley, that figure could skyrocket to $55 billion – $75 billion as a result of the “shee
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Cursor 2.0 adds coding model, UI for parallel agents
item.description: Anysphere has introduced Cursor 2.0, an update to the AI coding assistant that features the tool’s first coding model, called Composer, and an interface for working with many agents in parallel. Both Cursor 2.0 and Composer were introduced October 29 by the Cursor team at Anysphere.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Meta shares slide after company projects higher expenses for 2026
item.description: Meta's stock slid in after-hours trading on Wednesday after the tech giant posted strong third-quarter results but warned that its expenses will be significantly higher in 2026 than this year. Like its rivals, Meta Platforms Inc.
item.dc:creator: BARBARA ORTUTAY, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Google's corporate parent posts first-ever quarter with $100B in revenue in latest show of its power
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Google’s corporate parent on Wednesday announced its first-ever quarter with more than $100 billion in revenue, a milestone that illustrates the unwavering power of its internet empire amid legal and competitive threats. The news of Alphabet Inc.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL LIEDTKE, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Microsoft deploys a fix to Azure cloud service that's hit with outage
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Microsoft has deployed a fix to address an outage of their Azure cloud portal that left users unable to access Office 365, Minecraft and other services.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KRON4

item.title: Character.AI is banning minors from interacting with its chatbots
item.description: Character.AI is banning minors from using its chatbots amid growing concerns about the effects of artificial intelligence conversations on children.
item.dc:creator: BARBARA ORTUTAY, Associated Press, KRON4

item.title: Arista fills out AI networking portfolio
item.description: Arista Networks has added more models, greater speed, and new line cards to its portfolio of high-performance networking gear targeting large-scale AI and cloud data center customers.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Eight Sleep adds outage mode after AWS disruption
item.description: Mattress owners reported that their beds were stuck at sweltering temperatures and uncomfortable incline positions.
item.dc:creator: Taylor Delandro, NewsNation

item.title: GitHub launches Agent HQ to bring order to AI-powered coding
item.description: GitHub is taking a major step toward redefining enterprise software development with the launch of Agent HQ, a platform that lets developers manage and orchestrate multiple AI coding agents from OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, and others directly within the GitHub environment.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Startup giving away 3 billion free ads to help US businesses
item.description: Australian startup Cuttable is looking to change the landscape of e-commerce advertising in the United States.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Djordjevic, NewsNation

item.title: Elon Musk launches AI Grokipedia to compete with Wikipedia
item.description: The site comes after conservatives have criticized Wikipedia for exclouding some conservative outlets from its list of reputable sources.
item.dc:creator: Steph Whiteside, NewsNation

item.title: How to use passkeys to keep your computer safe
item.description: Learn how to use passkeys on Windows and Mac computers without cameras or fingerprint readers. Discover secure authentication methods that replace passwords.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: 2025 global network outage report and internet health check
item.description: The reliability of services delivered by ISPs, cloud providers and conferencing services is critical for enterprise organizations.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: How to deploy an AI agent that actually solves help desk tickets
item.description: Help desks need help. But many of the agents coming to the rescue are chatbots in disguise. They claim to “resolve tickets” or “transform IT support,” but when you actually roll them out, most of these tools end up routing tickets, not resolving them.
item.dc:creator: Info World
